caption: BehindTheScenes with our dedicated Citizen on Patrol (COP) volunteers who play a vital role in keeping our neighbourhoods safe. From patrolling their estates to sharing crime prevention tips and alerting the Police to suspicious activities, COP volunteers are the extra eyes and ears that help build a safer living environment for everyone. Watch the Home Teams Honour and Unity micro-drama series on Mediacorps TikTok and YouTube Shorts.OneHomeTeam HonourAndUnity PartnerwithHT HTVolunteers OrdinaryPeopleExtraordinaryMission

On set, the professionalism and empathy of our Officers shone through, adding depth and authenticity to every scene they were part of. As Captains of Lives, the officers role goes far beyond secure custody. They are also mentors and changemakers who support the inmates rehabilitation and reintegration, helping them rebuild their lives and return to society with confidence. Watch the Home Teams Honour and Unity micro-drama series on Mediacorps TikTok and YouTube Shorts.OneHomeTeam HonourAndUnity BehindTheScenes CaptainsOfLives

Get ready for an adrenaline-pumping operation with CNBs Special Task Force (STF) officers to take down syndicates and keep Singapore drug-free. Trained for the toughest missions, STF officers combine their peak physical fitness, sharp tactical instincts, and specialised skills with teamwork, strategy and discipline to execute their operations successfully. Watch the Home Teams Honour and Unity micro-drama series on Mediacorps TikTok and YouTube Shorts.OneHomeTeam HonourAndUnity BehindTheScenes

Different roles but with one shared purpose, the Home Team works together to keep Singapore safe and secure.SG60 TriviaTuesday

The Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Amendments) Bill was passed in Parliament today. The key amendments are:Revised caning penaltiesAmendments to sexual offences and increased penalties to protect vulnerable victimsIncreased penalties for fatal abuse of vulnerable victimsIncreased protection against doxxing for public servants and public service workersAdequate penalties for older youth offendersUpdated regulatory requirements for workers and dealers in precious metals The amendments are part of MHAs continuous efforts to make our criminal laws clearer, fairer and more responsive to the prevailing operating environment.

A Ministerial Statement on race and religion was made in Parliament today. Heres what you need to know.1. Race and religion should never be exploited for electoral purposes.2. While we enjoy strong racial and religious harmony in Singapore, we are not immune to divisive identity politics.3. We must all commit to handling issues of race and religion in a responsible and sensible manner.

From 1 January 2026, lorries with maximum laden weight between 3,501kg and 12,000kg must be installed with speed limiters by staggered deadlines.Speed limiters can help companies save fuel and help drivers avoid speeding offences and accidents, thereby reducing safety risks and operational downtime. It takes as little as 30 minutes to install a speed limiter on a lorry.Dont postpone installation any further. Install a speed limiter today!

As part of a phased operationalisation of the Immigration (Amendment) Act 2023, changes will be introduced to the Permanent Resident Re-Entry Permit application process from 1 December 2025.
As part of a phased operationalisation of the Immigration (Amendment) Act 2023, changes will be introduced to the Permanent Resident Re-Entry Permit application process from 1 December 2025.

At the opening of the First Session of the 15th Parliament, President Tharman Shanmugaratnam outlined the Governments commitment to secure our home and safeguard Singapores place in the world. Heres how the Home Team will continue to keep Singapore safe and secure.
